00119 INT32 FAR PASCAL WindowProcedure(HWND hWindow, UINT16 Message, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00120 { 
00121       static BOOLEAN fRestore = FALSE;
00122 
00123   if(gfIgnoreMessages)
00124             return(DefWindowProc(hWindow, Message, wParam, lParam));
00125 
00126       // ATE: This is for older win95 or NT 3.51 to get MOUSE_WHEEL Messages
00127       if ( Message == guiMouseWheelMsg )
00128       {
00129       QueueEvent(MOUSE_WHEEL, wParam, lParam);
00130                   return( 0L );
00131       }
00132  
00133       switch(Message)
00134   {
00135             case WM_MOUSEWHEEL:
00136                   {
00137                         QueueEvent(MOUSE_WHEEL, wParam, lParam);
00138                         break;
00139                   }
00140             
00141 #ifdef JA2
00142 #ifdef WINDOWED_MODE
00143     case WM_MOVE:
00144 
00145         GetClientRect(hWindow, &rcWindow);
00146         ClientToScreen(hWindow, (LPPOINT)&rcWindow);
00147         ClientToScreen(hWindow, (LPPOINT)&rcWindow+1);
00148         break;
00149 #endif
00150 #else
00151             case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00152                   break;
00153 
00154             case WM_SIZING:
00155             {
00156                   LPRECT      lpWindow;
00157                   INT32       iWidth, iHeight, iX, iY;
00158                   BOOLEAN fWidthByHeight=FALSE, fHoldRight=FALSE;
00159 
00160                   lpWindow = (LPRECT) lParam;  
00161 
00162                   iWidth=lpWindow->right-lpWindow->left;
00163                   iHeight=lpWindow->bottom-lpWindow->top;
00164                   iX = (lpWindow->left + lpWindow->right)/2;
00165                   iY = (lpWindow->top + lpWindow->bottom)/2;
00166 
00167                   switch(wParam)
00168                   {
00169                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMLEFT:
00170                               fHoldRight=TRUE;
00171                         case WMSZ_BOTTOM:
00172                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMRIGHT:
00173                               if(iHeight < SCREEN_HEIGHT)
00174                               {
00175                                     lpWindow->bottom=lpWindow->top+SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00176                                     iHeight=SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00177                               }
00178                               fWidthByHeight=TRUE;
00179                         break;
00180 
00181                         case WMSZ_TOPLEFT:
00182                               fHoldRight=TRUE;
00183                         case WMSZ_TOP:
00184                         case WMSZ_TOPRIGHT:
00185                               if(iHeight < SCREEN_HEIGHT)
00186                               {
00187                                     lpWindow->top=lpWindow->bottom-SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00188                                     iHeight=SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00189                               }
00190                               fWidthByHeight=TRUE;
00191                               break;
00192 
00193                         case WMSZ_LEFT:
00194                               if(iWidth < SCREEN_WIDTH)
00195                               {
00196                                     lpWindow->left=lpWindow->right-SCREEN_WIDTH;
00197                                     iWidth = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00198                               }
00199                               break;
00200 
00201                         case WMSZ_RIGHT:
00202                               if(iWidth < SCREEN_WIDTH)
00203                               {
00204                                     lpWindow->right=lpWindow->left+SCREEN_WIDTH;
00205                                     iWidth = SCREEN_WIDTH;
00206                               }
00207                   }
00208 
00209                   // Calculate width as a factor of height
00210                   if(fWidthByHeight)
00211                   {
00212                         iWidth = iHeight * SCREEN_WIDTH / SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00213 //                      lpWindow->left = iX - iWidth/2;
00214 //                      lpWindow->right = iX + iWidth / 2;
00215                         if(fHoldRight)
00216                               lpWindow->left = lpWindow->right - iWidth;
00217                         else
00218                               lpWindow->right = lpWindow->left + iWidth;
00219                   }
00220                   else // Calculate height as a factor of width
00221                   {
00222                         iHeight = iWidth * SCREEN_HEIGHT / SCREEN_WIDTH;
00223 //                      lpWindow->top = iY - iHeight/2;
00224 //                      lpWindow->bottom = iY + iHeight/2;
00225                         lpWindow->bottom = lpWindow->top + iHeight;
00226                   }
00227       
00228 
00229 /*
00230                   switch(wParam)
00231                   {
00232                         case WMSZ_BOTTOM:
00233                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMLEFT:
00234                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMRIGHT:
00235                               if(iHeight < SCREEN_HEIGHT)
00236                                     lpWindow->bottom=lpWindow->top+SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00237                   }
00238 
00239                   switch(wParam)
00240                   {
00241                         case WMSZ_TOP:
00242                         case WMSZ_TOPLEFT:
00243                         case WMSZ_TOPRIGHT:
00244                               if(iHeight < SCREEN_HEIGHT)
00245                                     lpWindow->top=lpWindow->bottom-SCREEN_HEIGHT;
00246                   }
00247 
00248                   switch(wParam)
00249                   {
00250                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMLEFT:
00251                         case WMSZ_LEFT:
00252                         case WMSZ_TOPLEFT:
00253                               if(iWidth < SCREEN_WIDTH)
00254                                     lpWindow->left=lpWindow->right-SCREEN_WIDTH;
00255                   }
00256 
00257                   switch(wParam)
00258                   {
00259                         case WMSZ_BOTTOMRIGHT:
00260                         case WMSZ_RIGHT:
00261                         case WMSZ_TOPRIGHT:
00262                               if(iWidth < SCREEN_WIDTH)
00263                                     lpWindow->right=lpWindow->left+SCREEN_WIDTH;
00264                   }
00265 */
00266             }
00267             break;
00268 
00269     case WM_SIZE:
00270             {
00271                   UINT16 nWidth = LOWORD(lParam);  // width of client area 
00272                   UINT16 nHeight = HIWORD(lParam); // height of client area 
00273 
00274                   if(nWidth && nHeight)
00275                   {
00276                         switch(wParam)
00277                         {
00278                               case SIZE_MAXIMIZED:
00279                                     VideoFullScreen(TRUE);
00280                                     break;
00281 
00282                               case SIZE_RESTORED:
00283                                     VideoResizeWindow();
00284                                     break;
00285                         }
00286                   }
00287             }
00288             break;
00289 
00290     case WM_MOVE:
00291             {
00292                   INT32 xPos = (INT32)LOWORD(lParam);    // horizontal position 
00293                   INT32 yPos = (INT32)HIWORD(lParam);    // vertical position             
00294             }
00295             break;
00296 #endif
00297 
00298     case WM_ACTIVATEAPP: 
00299       switch(wParam)
00300       {
00301         case TRUE: // We are restarting DirectDraw
00302           if (fRestore == TRUE)
00303           {
00304 #ifdef JA2
00305                 RestoreVideoManager();
00306                     RestoreVideoSurfaces();     // Restore any video surfaces
00307 
00308                                     // unpause the JA2 Global clock
00309             if ( !gfPauseDueToPlayerGamePause )
00310             {
00311                                       PauseTime( FALSE );
00312             }
00313 #else
00314                                     if(!VideoInspectorIsEnabled())
00315                                     {
00316                   RestoreVideoManager();
00317                       RestoreVideoSurfaces();   // Restore any video surfaces
00318                                     }
00319 
00320                 MoveTimer(TIMER_RESUME);
00321 #endif
00322             gfApplicationActive = TRUE;
00323           }
00324           break;
00325         case FALSE: // We are suspending direct draw
00326 #ifdef JA2
00327                                     // pause the JA2 Global clock
00328                                     PauseTime( TRUE );
00329                                     SuspendVideoManager();
00330 #else
00331 #ifndef UTIL 
00332                                     if(!VideoInspectorIsEnabled())
00333                                           SuspendVideoManager();
00334 #endif
00335 #endif
00336           // suspend movement timer, to prevent timer crash if delay becomes long
00337           // * it doesn't matter whether the 3-D engine is actually running or not, or if it's even been initialized
00338           // * restore is automatic, no need to do anything on reactivation
00339 #if !defined( JA2 ) && !defined( UTIL )
00340           MoveTimer(TIMER_SUSPEND);
00341 #endif
00342 
00343           gfApplicationActive = FALSE;
00344           fRestore = TRUE;
00345           break;
00346       }
00347       break;
00348 
00349     case WM_CREATE: 
00350                   break;
00351 
00352     case WM_DESTROY: 
00353                   ShutdownStandardGamingPlatform();
00354       ShowCursor(TRUE);
00355       PostQuitMessage(0);
00356       break;
00357 
00358             case WM_SETFOCUS:
00359 #if !defined( JA2 ) && !defined( UTIL )
00360                   if(!VideoInspectorIsEnabled())
00361                         RestoreVideoManager();
00362                   gfApplicationActive=TRUE;
00363 //                RestrictMouseToXYXY(0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT);
00364 #else
00365       RestoreCursorClipRect( );
00366 #endif
00367 
00368                   break;
00369 
00370             case WM_KILLFOCUS:
00371 #if !defined( JA2 ) && !defined( UTIL )
00372                   if(!VideoInspectorIsEnabled())
00373                         SuspendVideoManager();
00374 
00375                   gfApplicationActive=FALSE;
00376                   FreeMouseCursor();
00377 #endif
00378                   // Set a flag to restore surfaces once a WM_ACTIVEATEAPP is received
00379                   fRestore = TRUE;
00380                   break;
00381 
00382 
00383 #if defined( JA2 )
00384             case  WM_DEVICECHANGE:
00385                   {
00386                         //DEV_BROADCAST_HDR  *pHeader = (DEV_BROADCAST_HDR  *)lParam;
00387 
00388                         ////if a device has been removed
00389                         //if( wParam == DBT_DEVICEREMOVECOMPLETE )
00390                         //{
00391                         //    //if its  a disk
00392                         //    if( pHeader->dbch_devicetype == DBT_DEVTYP_VOLUME )
00393                         //    {
00394                         //          //check to see if the play cd is still in the cdrom
00395                         //          if( !CheckIfGameCdromIsInCDromDrive() )
00396                         //          {
00397                         //          }
00398                         //    }
00399                         //}
00400                   }
00401                   break;
00402 #endif
00403 
00404     default
00405     : return DefWindowProc(hWindow, Message, wParam, lParam);
00406   }
00407   return 0L;
00408 }

00412 BOOLEAN InitializeStandardGamingPlatform(HINSTANCE hInstance, int sCommandShow)
00413 {
00414       FontTranslationTable *pFontTable;
00415 
00416       // now required by all (even JA2) in order to call ShutdownSGP
00417       atexit(SGPExit);
00418 
00419       // First, initialize the registry keys.
00420       InitializeRegistryKeys( "Wizardry8", "Wizardry8key" );
00421 
00422       // For rendering DLLs etc.
00423 #ifndef JA2
00424       AddSubdirectoryToPath("DLL");
00425 #endif
00426 
00427       // Second, read in settings
00428       GetRuntimeSettings( );
00429 
00430       // Initialize the Debug Manager - success doesn't matter
00431       InitializeDebugManager();
00432 
00433       // Now start up everything else.
00434       RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_SGP, "Standard Gaming Platform");
00435 
00436   // this one needs to go ahead of all others (except Debug), for MemDebugCounter to work right...
00437       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Memory Manager");
00438       // Initialize the Memory Manager
00439       if (InitializeMemoryManager() == FALSE)
00440       { // We were unable to initialize the memory manager
00441             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Memory Manager");
00442             return FALSE;
00443       }
00444 
00445 #ifdef JA2
00446   FastDebugMsg("Initializing Mutex Manager");
00447       // Initialize the Dirty Rectangle Manager
00448       if (InitializeMutexManager() == FALSE)
00449       { // We were unable to initialize the game
00450             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Mutex Manager");
00451             return FALSE;
00452       }
00453 #endif
00454 
00455       FastDebugMsg("Initializing File Manager");
00456       // Initialize the File Manager
00457       if (InitializeFileManager(NULL) == FALSE)
00458       { // We were unable to initialize the file manager
00459             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing File Manager");
00460             return FALSE;
00461       }
00462 
00463       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Containers Manager");
00464   InitializeContainers();
00465 
00466       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Input Manager");
00467       // Initialize the Input Manager
00468       if (InitializeInputManager() == FALSE)
00469       { // We were unable to initialize the input manager
00470             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Input Manager");
00471             return FALSE;
00472       }
00473 
00474       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Video Manager");
00475       // Initialize DirectDraw (DirectX 2)
00476       if (InitializeVideoManager(hInstance, (UINT16) sCommandShow, (void *) WindowProcedure) == FALSE)
00477       { // We were unable to initialize the video manager
00478             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Video Manager");
00479             return FALSE;
00480       }
00481 
00482       // Initialize Video Object Manager
00483       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Video Object Manager");
00484       if ( !InitializeVideoObjectManager( ) )
00485       { 
00486             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Video Object Manager");
00487             return FALSE;
00488       }
00489 
00490       // Initialize Video Surface Manager
00491       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Video Surface Manager");
00492       if ( !InitializeVideoSurfaceManager( ) )
00493       { 
00494             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Video Surface Manager");
00495             return FALSE;
00496       }
00497 
00498       // Snap: moved the following from InitJA2SplashScreen for clarity
00499       STRING512               CurrentDir;
00500       STRING512               DataDir;
00501 
00502       InitializeJA2Clock();
00503       //InitializeJA2TimerID();
00504       // Get Executable Directory
00505       GetExecutableDirectory( CurrentDir );
00506 
00507       // Adjust Current Dir
00508       sprintf( DataDir, "%s\\Data", CurrentDir );
00509       if ( !SetFileManCurrentDirectory( DataDir ) )
00510       {
00511             DebugMsg( TOPIC_JA2, DBG_LEVEL_3, "Could not find data directory, shutting down");
00512             return FALSE;
00513       }
00514 
00515       //Initialize the file database
00516       //InitializeFileDatabase( gGameLibaries, NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES ); // ?!?! doesn't take parameters (jonathanl)
00517       InitializeFileDatabase();
00518 
00519       // Snap: Initialize the Data directory catalogue
00520       gDefaultDataCat.NewCat(DataDir);
00521 
00522       // Snap: Get the custom Data directory location from ja2.ini (if any)
00523       // and initialize the custom catalogue
00524       char customDataPath[MAX_PATH];
00525       if ( GetPrivateProfileString( "Ja2 Settings","CUSTOM_DATA_LOCATION", "", customDataPath, MAX_PATH, "..\\Ja2.ini" ) ) {
00526             gCustomDataCat.NewCat(std::string(CurrentDir) + '\\' + customDataPath);
00527       }
00528 
00529       //#ifdef JA2
00530             InitJA2SplashScreen();
00531       //#endif
00532 
00533   // Make sure we start up our local clock (in milliseconds)
00534   // We don't need to check for a return value here since so far its always TRUE
00535   InitializeClockManager();  // must initialize after VideoManager, 'cause it uses ghWindow
00536 
00537       // Create font translation table (store in temp structure)
00538       pFontTable = CreateEnglishTransTable( );
00539       if ( pFontTable == NULL )
00540       {
00541             return( FALSE );
00542       }
00543 
00544       // Initialize Font Manager
00545       FastDebugMsg("Initializing the Font Manager");
00546       // Init the manager and copy the TransTable stuff into it.
00547       if ( !InitializeFontManager( 8, pFontTable ) )
00548       { 
00549             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Font Manager");
00550             return FALSE;
00551       }
00552       // Don't need this thing anymore, so get rid of it (but don't de-alloc the contents)
00553       MemFree( pFontTable );
00554 
00555       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Sound Manager");
00556       // Initialize the Sound Manager (DirectSound)
00557 #ifndef UTIL
00558       if (InitializeSoundManager() == FALSE)
00559       { // We were unable to initialize the sound manager
00560             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Sound Manager");
00561             return FALSE;
00562       }  
00563 #endif
00564 
00565       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Random");
00566   // Initialize random number generator
00567   InitializeRandom(); // no Shutdown
00568 
00569       FastDebugMsg("Initializing Game Manager");
00570       // Initialize the Game
00571       if (InitializeGame() == FALSE)
00572       { // We were unable to initialize the game
00573             FastDebugMsg("FAILED : Initializing Game Manager");
00574             return FALSE;
00575       }
00576 
00577       // Register mouse wheel message
00578       guiMouseWheelMsg = RegisterWindowMessage( MSH_MOUSEWHEEL );
00579 
00580       gfGameInitialized = TRUE;
00581       
00582       return TRUE;
00583 }
00584 
00585 
00586 void ShutdownStandardGamingPlatform(void)
00587 {
00588 #ifndef JA2
00589       static BOOLEAN Reenter = FALSE;
00590 
00591       //
00592       // Prevent multiple reentry into this function
00593       //
00594 
00595       if (Reenter == FALSE)
00596       {
00597             Reenter = TRUE;
00598       }
00599       else
00600       {
00601             return;
00602       }
00603 #endif
00604 
00605       //
00606       // Shut down the different components of the SGP
00607       //
00608 
00609       // TEST
00610       SoundServiceStreams();
00611 
00612       if (gfGameInitialized)
00613       {
00614             ShutdownGame();  
00615       }
00616 
00617 
00618       ShutdownButtonSystem();
00619       MSYS_Shutdown();
00620 
00621 #ifndef UTIL
00622   ShutdownSoundManager();
00623 #endif
00624 
00625       DestroyEnglishTransTable( );    // has to go before ShutdownFontManager()
00626   ShutdownFontManager();
00627 
00628   ShutdownClockManager();   // must shutdown before VideoManager, 'cause it uses ghWindow
00629 
00630 #ifdef SGP_VIDEO_DEBUGGING
00631       PerformVideoInfoDumpIntoFile( "SGPVideoShutdownDump.txt", FALSE );
00632 #endif
00633 
00634       ShutdownVideoSurfaceManager();
00635   ShutdownVideoObjectManager();
00636   ShutdownVideoManager();
00637 
00638   ShutdownInputManager();
00639   ShutdownContainers();
00640   ShutdownFileManager();
00641 #ifdef JA2
00642   ShutdownMutexManager();
00643 #endif
00644 
00645 #ifdef EXTREME_MEMORY_DEBUGGING
00646       DumpMemoryInfoIntoFile( "ExtremeMemoryDump.txt", FALSE );
00647 #endif
00648 
00649   ShutdownMemoryManager();  // must go last (except for Debug), for MemDebugCounter to work right...
00650 
00651       //
00652   // Make sure we unregister the last remaining debug topic before shutting
00653   // down the debugging layer
00654   UnRegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_SGP, "Standard Gaming Platform");
00655 
00656   ShutdownDebugManager();
00657 }
00658 
00659 
00660 int PASCAL WinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance,  HINSTANCE hPrevInstance, LPSTR pCommandLine, int sCommandShow)
00661 {
00662 
00663 //If we are to use exception handling
00664 #ifdef ENABLE_EXCEPTION_HANDLING
00665       int Result = -1;
00666 
00667 
00668       __try
00669       {
00670             Result = HandledWinMain(hInstance, hPrevInstance, pCommandLine, sCommandShow);
00671       }
00672       __except( RecordExceptionInfo( GetExceptionInformation() ))
00673       {
00674             // Do nothing here - RecordExceptionInfo() has already done
00675             // everything that is needed. Actually this code won't even
00676             // get called unless you return EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER from
00677             // the __except clause.
00678 
00679 
00680       }
00681       return Result;
00682 
00683 }
00684 
00685 //Do not place code in between WinMain and Handled WinMain
00686 
00687 
00688 
00689 int PASCAL HandledWinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance,  HINSTANCE hPrevInstance, LPSTR pCommandLine, int sCommandShow)
00690 {
00691 //DO NOT REMOVE, used for exception handing list above in WinMain
00692 #endif
00693   MSG                   Message;
00694       HWND              hPrevInstanceWindow;
00695 
00696       // Make sure that only one instance of this application is running at once
00697       // // Look for prev instance by searching for the window
00698       hPrevInstanceWindow = FindWindowEx( NULL, NULL, APPLICATION_NAME, APPLICATION_NAME );
00699 
00700       // One is found, bring it up!
00701       if ( hPrevInstanceWindow != NULL )
00702       {
00703             SetForegroundWindow( hPrevInstanceWindow );
00704             ShowWindow( hPrevInstanceWindow, SW_RESTORE );
00705             return( 0 );
00706       }
00707 
00708       //rain
00709       //NSLoadSettings();
00710       //NSSaveSettings();
00711       //InitResolution();
00712 
00713       //EmergencyExitButtonInit();
00714       //end rain
00715 
00716 
00717       ghInstance = hInstance;
00718 
00719             // Copy commandline!
00720 #ifdef JA2
00721       strncpy( gzCommandLine, pCommandLine, 100);
00722       gzCommandLine[99]='\0';
00723 
00724       //Process the command line BEFORE initialization
00725       ProcessJa2CommandLineBeforeInitialization( pCommandLine );
00726 #else
00727       ProcessCommandLine(pCommandLine);
00728 #endif
00729 
00730       // Mem Usage
00731       giStartMem = MemGetFree(  ) / 1024;
00732   
00733 
00734 #ifdef JA2
00735       // Handle Check for CD
00736       if ( !HandleJA2CDCheck( ) )
00737       {
00738             return( 0 );
00739       }
00740 #else
00741 
00742       if(!RunSetup())
00743             return(0);
00744 
00745 #endif
00746 
00747   ShowCursor(FALSE);
00748 
00749   // Inititialize the SGP
00750   if (InitializeStandardGamingPlatform(hInstance, sCommandShow) == FALSE)
00751   { // We failed to initialize the SGP
00752     return 0;
00753   }
00754 
00755 #ifdef JA2
00756       #ifdef ENGLISH
00757             SetIntroType( INTRO_SPLASH );
00758       #endif
00759 #endif
00760 
00761   gfApplicationActive = TRUE;
00762   gfProgramIsRunning = TRUE;
00763 
00764   FastDebugMsg("Running Game");
00765 
00766   // At this point the SGP is set up, which means all I/O, Memory, tools, etc... are available. All we need to do is 
00767   // attend to the gaming mechanics themselves
00768   while (gfProgramIsRunning)
00769   {
00770     if (PeekMessage(&Message, NULL, 0, 0, PM_NOREMOVE))
00771     { // We have a message on the WIN95 queue, let's get it
00772       if (!GetMessage(&Message, NULL, 0, 0))
00773       { // It's quitting time
00774         return Message.wParam;
00775       }
00776       // Ok, now that we have the message, let's handle it
00777       TranslateMessage(&Message);
00778       DispatchMessage(&Message);      
00779     }
00780     else
00781     { // Windows hasn't processed any messages, therefore we handle the rest
00782       if (gfApplicationActive == FALSE)
00783       { // Well we got nothing to do but to wait for a message to activate
00784         WaitMessage();
00785       } 
00786       else
00787       { // Well, the game is active, so we handle the game stuff        
00788         GameLoop();        
00789 
00790                         // After this frame, reset input given flag
00791             gfSGPInputReceived  =  FALSE;             
00792       }
00793     }
00794   }
00795 
00796   // This is the normal exit point
00797   FastDebugMsg("Exiting Game");
00798   PostQuitMessage(0);
00799 
00800       // SGPExit() will be called next through the atexit() mechanism...  This way we correctly process both normal exits and
00801       // emergency aborts (such as those caused by a failed assertion).
00802 
00803       // return wParam of the last message received
00804       return Message.wParam;
00805 }
00806 
00807 
00808 
00809 void SGPExit(void)
00810 {
00811       static BOOLEAN fAlreadyExiting = FALSE;
00812       BOOLEAN fUnloadScreens = TRUE;
00813 
00814 
00815       // helps prevent heap crashes when multiple assertions occur and call us
00816       if ( fAlreadyExiting )
00817       {
00818             return;
00819       }
00820 
00821       fAlreadyExiting = TRUE;
00822       gfProgramIsRunning = FALSE;
00823 
00824 // Wizardry only
00825 #if !defined( JA2 ) && !defined( UTIL )
00826       if (gfGameInitialized)
00827       {
00828 // ARM: if in DEBUG mode & we've ShutdownWithErrorBox, don't unload screens and release data structs to permit easier debugging
00829 #ifdef _DEBUG
00830             if (gfIgnoreMessages)
00831             {
00832                   fUnloadScreens = FALSE;
00833             }
00834 #endif
00835             GameloopExit(fUnloadScreens);
00836       }
00837 #endif
00838 
00839       ShutdownStandardGamingPlatform();
00840   ShowCursor(TRUE);
00841       if(strlen(gzErrorMsg))
00842   {
00843             MessageBox(NULL, gzErrorMsg, "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONERROR  );
00844   }
00845 
00846 #ifndef JA2
00847       VideoDumpMemoryLeaks();
00848 #endif
00849 
00850 }
00851 
00852 void GetRuntimeSettings( )
00853 {
00854       // Runtime settings - for now use INI file - later use registry
00855       STRING512         INIFile;          // Path to the ini file
00856       CHAR8             zScreenResolution[ 50 ];
00857       
00858       // Get Executable Directory
00859       GetExecutableDirectory( INIFile );
00860 
00861       strcat(INIFile, "\\Ja2.ini");
00862 
00863       iResolution = -1;
00864 
00865       if (GetPrivateProfileString( "Ja2 Settings","SCREEN_RESOLUTION", "", zScreenResolution, 50, INIFile ))
00866       {
00867             iResolution = atoi(zScreenResolution);
00868       }
00869 
00870       int   iResX;
00871       int iResY;
00872 
00873       switch (iResolution)
00874       {
00875             // 640x480
00876             case 0:
00877                   iResX = 640;
00878                   iResY = 480;
00879                   break;
00880             // 1024x768
00881             case 2:
00882                   iResX = 1024;
00883                   iResY = 768;
00884                   break;
00885             // 800x600
00886             default:
00887                   iResolution = 1;
00888                   iResX = 800;
00889                   iResY = 600;
00890                   break;
00891       }
00892 
00893       gbPixelDepth = GetPrivateProfileInt( "SGP", "PIXEL_DEPTH", PIXEL_DEPTH, INIFile );
00894 
00895       SCREEN_WIDTH = GetPrivateProfileInt( "SGP", "WIDTH", iResX, INIFile );
00896       SCREEN_HEIGHT = GetPrivateProfileInt( "SGP", "HEIGHT", iResY, INIFile );
00897 
00898       iScreenWidthOffset = (SCREEN_WIDTH - 640) / 2;
00899       iScreenHeightOffset = (SCREEN_HEIGHT - 480) / 2;
00900 }
00901 
00902 void ShutdownWithErrorBox(CHAR8 *pcMessage)
00903 {
00904       strncpy(gzErrorMsg, pcMessage, 255);
00905       gzErrorMsg[255]='\0';
00906       gfIgnoreMessages=TRUE;
00907 
00908       exit(0);
00909 }
00910 
00911 #if !defined(JA2) && !defined(UTILS)
00912 
00913 void ProcessCommandLine(CHAR8 *pCommandLine)
00914 {
00915 CHAR8 cSeparators[]="\t =";
00916 CHAR8 *pCopy=NULL, *pToken;
00917 
00918       pCopy=(CHAR8 *)MemAlloc(strlen(pCommandLine) + 1);
00919 
00920       Assert(pCopy);
00921       if(!pCopy)
00922             return;
00923 
00924       memcpy(pCopy, pCommandLine, strlen(pCommandLine)+1);
00925 
00926       pToken=strtok(pCopy, cSeparators);
00927       while(pToken)                                                                             
00928       {
00929             if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/NOSOUND", 8))
00930             {
00931                   SoundEnableSound(FALSE);
00932             }
00933             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/INSPECTOR", 10))
00934             {
00935                   VideoInspectorEnable();
00936             }
00937             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/VIDEOCFG", 9))
00938             {
00939                   pToken=strtok(NULL, cSeparators);
00940                   VideoSetConfigFile(pToken);
00941             }
00942             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/LOAD", 5))
00943             {
00944                   gfLoadAtStartup=TRUE;
00945             }
00946             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/WINDOW", 7))
00947             {
00948                   VideoFullScreen(FALSE);
00949             }
00950             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/BC", 7))
00951             {
00952                   gfUsingBoundsChecker = TRUE;
00953             }
00954             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/CAPTURE", 7))
00955             {
00956                   gfCapturingVideo = TRUE;
00957             }
00958             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/NOOCT", 6))
00959             {
00960                   NoOct();
00961             }
00962             else if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/STRINGDATA", 11))
00963             {
00964                   pToken=strtok(NULL, cSeparators);
00965                   gzStringDataOverride = (CHAR8 *)MemAlloc(strlen(pToken) + 1);
00966                   strcpy(gzStringDataOverride, pToken);
00967             }
00968 
00969             pToken=strtok(NULL, cSeparators);
00970       }
00971 
00972       MemFree(pCopy);
00973 }
00974 
00975 BOOLEAN RunSetup(void)
00976 {
00977       if(!FileExists(VideoGetConfigFile()))
00978             _spawnl(_P_WAIT, "3DSetup.EXE", "3DSetup.EXE", VideoGetConfigFile(), NULL);
00979 
00980       return(FileExists(VideoGetConfigFile()));
00981 }
00982 
00983 #endif
00984 
00985 
00986 
00987 void ProcessJa2CommandLineBeforeInitialization(CHAR8 *pCommandLine)
00988 {
00989       CHAR8 cSeparators[]="\t =";
00990       CHAR8 *pCopy=NULL, *pToken;
00991 
00992       pCopy=(CHAR8 *)MemAlloc(strlen(pCommandLine) + 1);
00993 
00994       Assert(pCopy);
00995       if(!pCopy)
00996             return;
00997 
00998       memcpy(pCopy, pCommandLine, strlen(pCommandLine)+1);
00999 
01000       pToken=strtok(pCopy, cSeparators);
01001       while(pToken)                                                                             
01002       {
01003             //if its the NO SOUND option
01004             if(!_strnicmp(pToken, "/NOSOUND", 8))
01005             {
01006                   //disable the sound
01007                   SoundEnableSound(FALSE);
01008             }
01009 
01010             //get the next token
01011             pToken=strtok(NULL, cSeparators);
01012       }
01013 
01014       MemFree(pCopy);
01015 }
